page.title: 18Tourism
page.content: A rather pretentious word for our area but we do get a lot of visitors. Ardely is in the Shell Book of English Villages & similar publications & with its village green, oak tree, pond & well is on the tourist circuit. Both churches are referred to in 'Pevesner' as is a 17 century dovecote & mill dating from 1828 in Walkern. The church in Walkern has a Norman doorway, a 14 century tower & a 13 century Purbeck marble effigy. That in Ardeley has traces of the original Norman church at the base of the tower carved angels with outspread wings in the roof of nave (13 century) & early 15 century font with the bowl dating back to the 12 century. Ardeley Bury, the big house, is not open to the public but can be seen from the surrounding countryside. The original Tudor House was made 'gothic' in 1820.
